Arnold, guys - 

Yes, I too wondered about kodogu shinsa, having several signed kinko tsuba that could benefit from a respected peer's okay-dokay! It would be good to know the judge's strong areas of kantie.

Has anybody heard how the shinsa slots are going for Chicago? Are they approaching a full booking or not? I was going to call Coleman and ask (which I might still do) but perhaps the question has already been answered. 

Ron
STL
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: arnold frenzel 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, June 24, 2004 6:08 PM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Inquiry


  Hi Jim:
  Can you confirm that Hagihara sensei will still be doing the kodogu at
  Chicago? It matters a lot to me in terms of what I bring. Thank you.
  Arnold afrenzel@...



  >>> jggilbert@... 06/23/04 5:10 PM >>>
  Rich,
  At least it is someone interpreting the Kaneie style.  The motif is a
  memento mori as you say.  Sometimes that motif is tied to Sekigahara,
  but seems like it could fit any battle.

  Jim

    wrote:
    > Just picked up this tsuba off ebay. What school?
    > Maybe Saga Kaneie? I assume (?) the theme refers
    > to death in battle, shortness of life, etc. with
    > dog eating/scattering the bones?
    > 
    > http://cgi.ebay.com/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&category=73466&item=
    > 3730529406&rd=1

    > 
    > Rich S

    In case the above link doesn't work. Here's a pic on my website.

    Rich
